references.paper_title: FEVER: a Large-scale Dataset for Fact Extraction and VERification
references.reason: This paper introduces the FEVER dataset, a benchmark used for evaluating the fact-checking performance of the proposed LOTUS system, which is central to the paper's evaluation methodology.

references.paper_title: FacTool: Factuality Detection in Generative AI - A Tool Augmented Framework for Multi-Task and Multi-Domain Scenarios
references.reason: This paper presents FacTool, a state-of-the-art fact-checking system used as a baseline for comparing the performance and efficiency of the proposed LOTUS system in the fact-checking task.

references.paper_title: BioDEX: Large-Scale Biomedical Adverse Drug Event Extraction for Real-World Pharmacovigilance
references.reason: This paper introduces the Biodex dataset, which is used for evaluating the extreme multi-label classification performance of the proposed LOTUS system, demonstrating the system's capability in a complex real-world application.

references.paper_title: BEIR: A Heterogenous Benchmark for Zero-shot Evaluation of Information Retrieval Models
references.reason: This paper introduces the BEIR benchmark, which provides datasets and evaluation metrics for information retrieval. It serves as a key benchmark for evaluating LOTUS's performance on the search and ranking tasks.

references.paper_title: DSPy: Compiling Declarative Language Model Calls into Self-Improving Pipelines
references.reason: This paper introduces DSPy, a system for compiling declarative language model calls into efficient pipelines. It is used as a comparison point for discussing the advantages of LOTUS's declarative programming model for semantic analytics.
